title: Bill Pepper
text:
William George Pepper (1895 – 25 October 1918) was an English professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> who played in the <a href="The%20Football%20League">Football League</a> for <a href="Leicester%20Fosse%20F.C.">Leicester Fosse</a>.
Personal life.
Pepper enlisted in the <a href="Queen%27s%20Own%20Royal%20West%20Kent%20Regiment">Queen's Own (Royal West Kent Regiment)</a> during the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a>. He spent time with the regiment in India before being deployed to the <a href="Middle%20Eastern%20theatre%20of%20World%20War%20I">Middle Eastern theatre</a> in December 1917. Pepper was serving as an <a href="Acting%20Lance-Corporal">acting lance corporal</a> when he was killed in <a href="Mesopotamian%20campaign">Iraq</a> during the <a href="Battle%20of%20Sharqat">Battle of Sharqat</a> on 25 October 1918. He is commemorated on the <a href="Basra%20Memorial">Basra Memorial</a>.
